clinical_study.brief_title: Per-operating Use of a Probe for Detection of β+
clinical_study.official_title: Per-operating Use of a Probe for Detection of β+

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of the study is to evaluate the sensibility of the probe Forimtech to detect β+ emission in vivo in humans and its usefulness during elective surgical procedure Hypothesis:The probe Forimtech is able to allow per-surgery detection of tumoral lesions sensible to 18F-FDG and to help in the realization of guided biopsies, minimally invasive surgery or complement of resection of tumors.
The β+ emission detected by the probe Forimtech is correlated to the emission γ detected by the 18F-FDG.PET/CT

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients with a malignant neoplasic lesion known or suspected for which a surgery is planned will be presented with the protocol. If inclusion/exclusion criteria are fulfilled all the procedures will be planned. A 18F-FDG PET/CT will be done. Surgery will be conducted within 3 hours after the I.V. injection of 18F-FDG according to the standard procedure applied in the visceral surgery department. During the surgery, emission of β+ from the lesion (s) seen during the PET/CT will be detected with the probe.
Resected pieces will be analysed histologically.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensibility of the probe β+ for detection per-surgery of hypermetabolic tumoral lesions
primary_outcome.description: Topography and intensity of detection by the probe of emission of β+ by the lesion(s) • Intensity of emission of β+ by the non specific background and the adjacent structures

secondary_outcome.description: 18F-FDG PET imaging: SUVmax of the lesion(s), SUVmean of the lesion(s), ratio SUVmax / SUVbackground CT imaging: Topography of / the lesion(s), size of / the lesion(s), distance with the surrounding organs

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensibility of the probe β+ for detection per-surgery of hypermetabolic tumoral lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Change in every primary interpretation criterion corresponding to the parameters of detection found during the operation will be studied and compared with the analysis of the parameters of the histology (gold standard) through an analysis ROC. They will be also studied compared with the analysis of the parameters PET/ CT

secondary_outcome.measure: .Comparison of AUC of the imaging methods
secondary_outcome.description: A comparison of the AUC will be realized to determine the superiority of a method compared with the other one, by a non parametric test comparing AUC, ROC curves respectively

Surgery will be conducted within 3 hours after the I.V. injection of 18F-FDG according to the standard procedure applied in the visceral surgery department. During the surgery, emission of β+ from the lesion (s) seen durint the PET/CT will be detected with the probe. Resected pieces will be analysed histologically.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age < 80 years old;
- Karnofsky index ≥80% ;
- Informed consent signed
- Patients with an indication of thoracic, visceral, or ENT surgery with the aim of a diagnostic biopsy, of an invasive minimal treatment, or an initial or complementary resection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Enable to sign informed consent
